segment.source: Perform KMS Activation (Windows 10)
segment.target: Perform KMS Activation (Windows 10)

segment.source: Perform KMS Activation
segment.target: Perform KMS Activation

segment.source: Perform KMS Activation
segment.target: Perform KMS Activation

segment.source: The Volume Activation Management Tool (VAMT) can be used to perform volume activation using the Key Management Service (KMS).
segment.target: The Volume Activation Management Tool (VAMT) can be used to perform volume activation using the Key Management Service (KMS).

segment.source: You can use VAMT to activate Generic Volume Licensing Keys, or KMS client keys, on products accessible to VAMT.
segment.target: You can use VAMT to activate Generic Volume Licensing Keys, or KMS client keys, on products accessible to VAMT.

segment.source: GVLKs are the default product keys used by the volume-license editions of Windows Vista, Windows 7, Windows 8, Windows 10, Windows Server 2008, Windows Server 2008 R2, Windows Server® 2012, and Microsoft Office 2010.
segment.target: GVLKs are the default product keys used by the volume-license editions of Windows Vista, Windows 7, Windows 8, Windows 10, Windows Server 2008, Windows Server 2008 R2, Windows Server® 2012, and Microsoft Office 2010.

segment.source: GVLKs are already installed in volume-license editions of these products.
segment.target: GVLKs are already installed in volume-license editions of these products.

segment.source: Requirements
segment.target: Requirements

segment.source: Before configuring KMS activation, ensure that your network and VAMT installation meet the following requirements:
segment.target: Before configuring KMS activation, ensure that your network and VAMT installation meet the following requirements:

segment.source: KMS host is set up and enabled.
segment.target: KMS host is set up and enabled.

segment.source: KMS clients can access the KMS host.
segment.target: KMS clients can access the KMS host.

segment.source: VAMT is installed on a central computer with network access to all client computers.
segment.target: VAMT is installed on a central computer with network access to all client computers.

segment.source: The products to be activated have been added to VAMT.
segment.target: The products to be activated have been added to VAMT.

segment.source: For more information on adding product keys, see Install a KMS Client Key.
segment.target: For more information on adding product keys, see Install a KMS Client Key.

segment.source: VAMT has administrative permissions on all computers to be activated, and Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI) is accessible through the Windows Firewall.
segment.target: VAMT has administrative permissions on all computers to be activated, and Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI) is accessible through the Windows Firewall.

segment.source: For more information, see Configure Client Computers.
segment.target: For more information, see Configure Client Computers.

segment.source: To configure devices for KMS activation
segment.target: To configure devices for KMS activation

segment.source: To configure devices for KMS activation
segment.target: To configure devices for KMS activation

segment.source: Open VAMT.
segment.target: Open VAMT.

segment.source: If necessary, set up the KMS activation preferences.
segment.target: If necessary, set up the KMS activation preferences.

segment.source: If you don’t need to set up the preferences, skip to step 6 in this procedure.
segment.target: If you don’t need to set up the preferences, skip to step 6 in this procedure.

segment.source: Otherwise, continue to step 2.
segment.target: Otherwise, continue to step 2.

segment.source: To set up the preferences, on the menu bar click View, then click Preferences to open the Volume Activation Management Tool Preferences dialog box.
segment.target: To set up the preferences, on the menu bar click View, then click Preferences to open the Volume Activation Management Tool Preferences dialog box.

segment.source: Under Key Management Services host selection, select one of the following options:
segment.target: Under Key Management Services host selection, select one of the following options:

segment.source: Find a KMS host automatically using DNS (default).
segment.target: Find a KMS host automatically using DNS (default).

segment.source: If you choose this option, VAMT first clears any previously configured KMS host on the target computer and instructs the computer to query the Domain Name Service (DNS) to locate a KMS host and attempt activation.
segment.target: If you choose this option, VAMT first clears any previously configured KMS host on the target computer and instructs the computer to query the Domain Name Service (DNS) to locate a KMS host and attempt activation.

segment.source: Find a KMS host using DNS in this domain for supported products.
segment.target: Find a KMS host using DNS in this domain for supported products.

segment.source: Enter the domain name.
segment.target: Enter the domain name.

segment.source: If you choose this option, VAMT first clears any previously configured KMS host on the target computer and instructs the computer to query the DNS in the specified domain to locate a KMS host and attempt activation.
segment.target: If you choose this option, VAMT first clears any previously configured KMS host on the target computer and instructs the computer to query the DNS in the specified domain to locate a KMS host and attempt activation.

segment.source: Use specific KMS host.
segment.target: Use specific KMS host.

segment.source: Enter the KMS host name and KMS host port.
segment.target: Enter the KMS host name and KMS host port.

segment.source: For environments which do not use DNS for KMS host identification, VAMT sets the specified KMS host name and KMS host port on the target computer, and then instructs the computer to attempt activation with the specific KMS host.
segment.target: For environments which do not use DNS for KMS host identification, VAMT sets the specified KMS host name and KMS host port on the target computer, and then instructs the computer to attempt activation with the specific KMS host.

segment.source: Click Apply, and then click OK to close the Volume Activation Management Tool Preferences dialog box.
segment.target: Click Apply, and then click OK to close the Volume Activation Management Tool Preferences dialog box.

segment.source: Select the products to be activated by selecting individual products in the product list view in the center pane.
segment.target: Select the products to be activated by selecting individual products in the product list view in the center pane.

segment.source: You can use the Filter function to narrow your search for computers by clicking Filter in the right-side pane to open the Filter Products dialog box.In the Filter Products dialog box, you can filter the list by computer name, product name, product key type, license status, or by any combination of these options.
segment.target: You can use the Filter function to narrow your search for computers by clicking Filter in the right-side pane to open the Filter Products dialog box.In the Filter Products dialog box, you can filter the list by computer name, product name, product key type, license status, or by any combination of these options.

segment.source: To filter the list by computer name, enter a name in the Computer Name box.
segment.target: To filter the list by computer name, enter a name in the Computer Name box.

segment.source: To filter the list by Product Name, Product Key Type, or License Status, click the list you want to use for the filter and select an option.
segment.target: To filter the list by Product Name, Product Key Type, or License Status, click the list you want to use for the filter and select an option.

segment.source: If necessary, click clear all filters to create a new filter.
segment.target: If necessary, click clear all filters to create a new filter.

segment.source: Click Filter.
segment.target: Click Filter.

segment.source: VAMT displays the filtered list in the center pane.
segment.target: VAMT displays the filtered list in the center pane.

segment.source: In the right-side pane, click Activate in the Selected Items menu, and then click Volume activate.
segment.target: In the right-side pane, click Activate in the Selected Items menu, and then click Volume activate.

segment.source: Click a credential option.
segment.target: Click a credential option.

segment.source: Choose Alternate credentials only if you are activating products that require administrator credentials different from the ones you are currently using.
segment.target: Choose Alternate credentials only if you are activating products that require administrator credentials different from the ones you are currently using.

segment.source: If you are supplying alternate credentials, at the prompt, type the appropriate user name and password and click OK.
segment.target: If you are supplying alternate credentials, at the prompt, type the appropriate user name and password and click OK.

segment.source: VAMT displays the Volume Activation dialog box until it completes the requested action.
segment.target: VAMT displays the Volume Activation dialog box until it completes the requested action.

segment.source: When the process is finished, the updated activation status of each product appears in the product list view in the center pane.
segment.target: When the process is finished, the updated activation status of each product appears in the product list view in the center pane.
